fields.summary: Display caps-lock indicator icon for password fields in Safari

fields.description: The search placeholder text is "search" in Safari, rather than "Search", and shows English even in other different languages.
fields.summary: Safari search placeholder is lowercase and not internationalised

fields.description: When the WebDAV plugin became bundled, we moved some of the documentation away from the plugin page to the [Conf Docs|http://confluence.atlassian.com/x/TEIC].  However, [webdav client setup|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFEXT/WebDAV+Client+Setup] is still in the plugins space.  We should either consolidate the two, or provide links between the two for people looking to configure the plugin.
fields.summary: WebDAV documentation needs to be consolidated

fields.description:
If the JIRA issues macro appears sufficiently close to the top of the page, then the Tools menu dropdown will go *underneath* the macro instead of over it.
This happens in IE7 but not chrome. I assume it only happens in IE
fields.summary: JIRA Issues Macro covers Tools Menu dropdown in IE7

fields.description:
When external user managent is set to OFF in General configuration, and any user tries to save their profile, we get a system error.
We are using crowd to handle the integration with our Active Directory infrastructure. We do not want people to be able to update their information into AD.

It happens for every user we have tried and goes away when we enable external user management.

here is the contents of the page:

System Error

A system error has occurred — our apologies!

Please ask your Confluence administrator to create a support issue on Atlassian's support system at http://support.atlassian.com with the following information:

   1. a description of your problem and what you were doing at the time it occurred
   2. a copy of the error and system information found below
   3. a copy of the application logs (if possible).

Your Confluence administrator can use the support request form to create a support ticket which will include this information.

We will respond as promptly as possible.
Thank you!

Return to site homepage...

As a Confluence user, I can receive an email notification alert when someone comments on a page I created regardless if a watch has been set or not so I can be notified when a user has commented on a page I created.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Applies to pages, news
- Preference on by default

- Only applies to pages where I was original creator

We have received this request from several users in our organization. They want to be notified of a comment but not every edit to a page.

fields.description: The people directory has been hidden from the users and I can limit that the person information updates are not show in the recently-updated section by limiting the spaces that it shows (not handy at all but works). Now the only problem is that I still can see all user and go to see them details when I search something. Could you please change the searching so that admin can decide if searching is done also from the people directory or not. Other and maybe more logical and better solution would be that when you enable people directory you shouldn't be able to find people with the search engine or to see them in the recently updated list. This is really critical issue when there are many customers using the same confluence instance and they should not be seeing each others in no way.
fields.summary: Do not search people when the people directory is hidden

fields.description:
The thread dump plugin does not generate output that can be used with common thread dump analysis tools like tda (https://tda.dev.java.net/).  Worse, the thread dump listener prevents users from generating a uable thread dump using kill -3.  The attached zip file contains two samples, one copied and pasted from the thread dump plugin in Confluence 3.0.0_01, the other generated after disabling the plugin and using "kill -3" to generate a thread dump.  The normal thread dump is twice the size of the Confluence thread dump, but opens immediately.  The thread dump generated with the plugin opens, but tda sits attempts to process it indefinitely without producing any output.

Steps to reproduce:

# Create a thread dump using the thread dump plugin
# Save to a file and then open from tda (or "open from clipboard" from within tda)
# Watch the memory bar, you can tell it's doing something, but it never comes up with results

The documentation suggests that you can generate a thread dump externally.  In my testing this won't work unless you disable the plugin and restart.
fields.summary: Thread dump plugin prevents manual thread dumps

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-16472].
  {panel}

I've been using Confluence every day for a year now and just now learned that you can select multiple users at the same time when applying page restrictions. Wow...what a time saver! For the past year I have been wasting a lot of time by:

# clicking on "choose users" to open a new window
# searching on the name of the user I want to add
# checking the box next to the user in the search results
# clicking on "Save as
# repeating for every user I want to add

I wonder if other users out there have encountered the same waste of time without realising that they can add multiple users at the same time by typing in a comma-separated list of usernames into the  _Enter user/group name(s)_ box and clicking _Add_.

The problem as I see it is twofold:
# The _Enter user/group name(s)_ doesn't do quicksearch on names like it does in JIRA. This requires me to know the actual Confluence username
# The Restrictions section of the page encourages me to click on the "Choose Users" tab (perhaps because it's prominent in the UI or perhaps because I don't know usernames). The problem with _Choose Users_ is that it doesn't allow you to choose multiple users.

If we added quicksearch to the user _Enter user/group names(s)_ field it would DRASTICALLY improve the experience. 

*How it works in JIRA*
!http://img.skitch.com/20090724-q1ga6ab83hscrbefnm96u2ycjt.png!

*How it works in Confluence*
!http://img.skitch.com/20090724-t4ei7jppqyhmuy66ybp3hi2rgm.png!
fields.summary: Page Restrictions: Add quicksearch to Enter user/group name(s)
Duplicate Attachment

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-16469].
  {panel}

It would help extremly to manage the disk space allocation of the data directory if it would be possible to apply an maximum number of attachment versions or by the maximum of file size in sum of all files.
Ofcurse an warning message would be needed for the user, so he is informed that he is going to reach the configured limit (2 versions before or 80% of maximum sum file size is reached).

In our case ther was one 20MB File that was 36 times versioned -> 720 MB diskusage only because one file.
Of curse some wiki's require such a big history list, so this feature should be configurable (number/size/on&off) in admin console. The file size sum limit has the advantage that it delivers a high number of versions on small files but a calculatable maximum for system administrators.

If this is not applicable CONF-5520 would be nice at least!
fields.summary: Ability to set a limit of attachment versions

fields.description:
A customer reported a problem with a very large page.  After some investigation, it appears that pages over a certain size cannot be saved in Firefox.  In my testing, the attached file (800K.txt) can be used to reproduce the problem as follows:

# Copy the contents of the file into a new page
# Save the page
# Edit the page
# Attempt to save the page again
# The error varies depending on the browser.  Some browsers (Firefox 3.0 on OS X, Firefox 3.5 on Windows) churn indefinitely.   When running Firefox 3.5 through a proxy (such as Fiddler), the error "You must enter a title" eventually appears.  The same message appears when saving using Internet Explorer 7 (no proxy).


The problem occurs with both Confluence 2.10.3 and Confluence 3.0.0_01.  Interestingly, the problem does not occur when using Safari on OS X, the page saves as expected.

In my testing, the problem does not occur with a 600K file, but occurs with a 700K file or larger.

The obvious workaround is to break down very large pages into sections and use the \{include\} macro.  In my opinion, adding a note about splitting the content to the fix for CONF-12773 would address this as well.
fields.summary: Very large pages (800,000 characters) view and edit slowly, but cannot be saved.

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Setting+up+your+Personal+Space
fields.summary: Update docs for setting up Personal Spaces

fields.description:
A customer would like to be able to publish the "export to PDF" link on their web site (as a kind of "Download latest documentation" link). 

This use case was satisfied by previous versions of Confluence, the addition of the XSRF token in the new PDF export bundled with Confluence 3.0 broke that use case.  Now, you are always given a link that includes an "atl_token" option which must be set, and which cannot be used on another computer, or even on the same computer once your session expires.

Steps to reproduce:

# Open a page visible to the public
# Copy the link to the PDF export from either the "Info" page or the "Tools" menu
# Log out (or log in as a different user)
# Attempt to load the same link

A message will appear indicating that the security token has expired.
fields.summary: PDF export link cannot be published to other sites...
Remember previous page position

fields.description:
Group administration screen allows you to Remove groups. When you select a group that has permissions associated with it (but in our case, there were no users who were members of this group) and click Remove you are given a list of spaces (but not personal spaces) and space permissions associated with the group. Then at the bottom of that list is a Confirm button to agree that you will lose all these permissions, etc. Click Confirm and you get an error message with the following trace:

{code}2009-07-23 14:18:59,579 ERROR [http-8080-5] [atlassian.confluence.servlet.ConfluenceServletDispatcher] sendError Could not execute action
 -- url: /admin/users/doremovegroup.action | userName: admin | referer: http://baseurl/admin/users/removegroup-confirm.action?atl_token=XdXImNHCIl&name=bsr
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.atlassian.confluence.security.ContentPermission.compareTo(ContentPermission.java:197)
	at java.util.TreeMap.put(TreeMap.java:545)
	at java.util.TreeSet.add(TreeSet.java:238)
	at java.util.AbstractCollection.addAll(AbstractCollection.java:305)
	at java.util.TreeSet.addAll(TreeSet.java:295)
{code}

If you then go through and manually find all the spaces and remove the group from the permissions list for each space then you can finally remove the group. Big problem if the group has access to personal spaces as the only way you can find that out is by querying the database - the personal space permissions do not show up on the aforementioned permissions listing.

You should be able to actually remove a group and all its permissions as long as there are no members of the group. Group removal should not be restricted to cases where there are *also* no permissions associated with the group, especially because it is impossible to see all the group's permissions (i.e. personal spaces) without querying the database manually.
fields.summary: Remove group fails if any group permissions set

fields.description:
To reproduce:

* View a Page in a Space
* View a Blogpost in a Space
* Use the {popular} macro with default values to view the popular content in the space

The macro has the default value of 'all' for the 'types' parameter. I would expect this to show both pages and blogs in the results.

However, this is not working, it will only show the most popular pages. Editing the parameter value to 'page,blogpost' will correctly show both pages and blogs.
fields.summary: MacroBrowser has invalid value ('all') for 'types' parameter in Popular Content macro shown on default

fields.description:
The viewfile macro is not able to display PDF file with wide content properly. The content will simply be cut off at the right hand side.

Also some content will be stretched to fit the flash player display screen making text difficult to read.

Perhaps if we have a functionality to automatically/manually adjust the width it might help.
fields.summary: Wide PDF content is not rendered properly

fields.description:
The profile panel makes baby jesus want to cry.

Often the panel sits on top of user content making it difficult to read what is below the panel.

The panel may be improved by:

* default turned off, have an expand option or hover option in the upper right
* open to minimize the panel

fields.description:

fields.description:
Dave O'Flynn found that when he inserted a new image onto a new line using the Rich Text Editor, it got sucked back onto the previous line when saving.  

It seems that this is only a problem the first time the image is saved, rather than a round-tripping issue.

I doubt that this is new to Confluence 3.1.
fields.summary: Image inserted on new line saves to the end of the previous line

Persistent Labels

fields.description:
Create a page with three links using RTE:

[a]
[a-b]
[a b]

Hit save, they will result in:

[a]
[a-b|a-b]
[a b]

Notice that "a-b" is aliased to "a-b", the same as the page's name. This is redundant and also bad for renames. When renaming the page "a-b" to "a-c" for example, all links to that page aren't updated due to the alias.

This must be due to the fact that a hyphen exists in the page name. This happens often with page names such as:

  - server-1.foo.com (technical names of devices, etc)
  - Twentieth-century (hyphenated words)
  - etc
fields.summary: RTE: Links containing a hyphen save with an alias, even if not necessary breaking renames

fields.description:
When editing a page in IE6, the load time is 5-6 seconds longer than it should be because the images for the drop shadows are not loading correctly.

The problem is caused by the use of double dots "../../.." or "../.." in the IE-specific css files.  IE6 somehow interprets these urls incorrectly and translates these to the wrong path. 

Log output from Fiddler is attached. If you don't have Windows, you can open it up as a zip file and the request/responses are stored as text files. 

The stylesheets work as expected in IE7.
fields.summary: broken hover shadows cause slow page edits in IE6
Officially Support openJDK

fields.description:
As documented at CONF-6992 there are various Confluence bugs about switching between Rich Text Editor and Wiki Markup Editor.  For the most part all these bugs can be tested by setting the wiki markup in the wiki markup editor, switching to the RTE tab, and switching back again.

There are some cases though, such as CONF-14512 where that use case round-trips correctly, but saving the page in between causes a change.

It seems that somewhere in the process of saving and retrieving the page, newline characters can get converted to carriage-return plus newline character pairs, and that there are instances where the Renderer treats these differently.
fields.summary: Saving a page can lead to round-trip errors that do not occur by just switching tabs.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-16408].
  {panel}

This issue affects all versions of Confluence up to 3.1 milestone 1. 

If a user has a draft for an existing page that is subsequently removed and purged, these are the problems: 

- we still present a resume draft link from the user's drafts page which when followed leads to the "page not found" screen
- we still present a view changes link from the user's drafts page which when pressed opens a light box which informs the user to check their logs for error output. 

We should not display the above two links in this circumstance. 

Further, we should preserve a user's changes to a page in the event of a delete and present a means for them to simply view or recover their changes. Right now, they have no access to it at all which is bad.
fields.summary: Handling of drafts for deleted content is broken

The following options are available in personal email settings:

# Show changed content (Description: Check this option to see changes made in Edit notification emails (HTML format only))
# Show full content (Description: Check this option to see the full Page/News content in Edit notification emails (HTML format only))

The above options do behave as expected, for example:

* If only option 1 is ticked, Confluence sends email with changed contents only
* If only option 2 is ticked, Confluence sends email with full contents only

However, if both of these options unticked, Confluence _still sends email with full contents (as if option 2 is ticked)._ User expects there should only be a summary of changes, similar to daily report.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-16394].
  {panel}

Advanced doc import breaks headers in a word document into multiple Confluence pages where each header is used as the page titles.

For example, before importing into Confluence the hierarchical structure of a document looks like this:
!before.png!

The result would look ugly in pagetree macro because the sort mechanism in pagetree macro does not know anything about the original document hierarchy:
!after.png!

We need a way to make the resulting pages come out sorted nicely as to make the best use out of the import.

Perhaps a work around for this is to give each title a unique header and assign a number as to enumerate them and sort them automatically in the pagetree macro. 

For example DocumentName-1, DocumentName-2 for each header and so on.
fields.summary: Advanced Doc Import confused pagetree page hierarchy

fields.summary: NPE when uploading a plugin through the repository UI
Attach files to user profile permission

fields.description:
I saw about 2500 errors of the form:

{code}
2009-07-15 19:28:43,874 ERROR [TP-Processor68] [org.directwebremoting.dwrp.Batch] error A request has been denied as a potential CSRF attack.
 -- referer: https://extranet.atlassian.com/pages/editpage.action?pageId=xxxxx | url: /dwr/call/plaincall/HeartbeatAjax.startActivity.dwr | userName: xxxxx
{code}

with corresponding access log:

{code}
203.63.130.33 - - [15/Jul/2009:19:28:43 -0500] "POST /dwr/call/plaincall/HeartbeatAjax.startActivity.dwr HTTP/1.1" 200 129 
  "https://extranet.atlassian.com/pages/editpage.action?pageId=1747687512" 
  "Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; U; Intel Mac OS X 10_5_7; en-us) AppleWebKit/530.18 (KHTML, like Gecko) Version/4.0.1 Safari/530.18" 6146
{code}

generated in 2 separate one-minute intervals.


The user reported that they'd left a wiki markup editor open overnight in Safari 4 and returned to the editor to see a plethora of "Session error" alerts. The Heartbeat is called every 30 seconds, 1200 times in 10 hours. It seems that in Safari 4 queued up these calls until the user revisited the browser and the JavaScript execution thread fired up to find 1200-1300 interval callbacks waiting to go. They were sent to EAC in the space of a minute which naturally returned session timeout behaviour which shows as a potential XSRF attack.

Without getting under the hood of Webkit / SquirrelFish Extreme I'd say the easiest solution would be to replace the setInterval heartbeat logic with an iterative setTimeout call.
fields.summary: Heartbeat interval callbacks queue up in Safari when editor left open

fields.description:
Going through the setup wizard, one of the options is to import existing data from XML.

When I try to do this, Confluence immediately refeshes saying "Completion:  	0% complete", and never updates any further:

!setuprestore.png!

Clicking "Next" would leave you with no imported data.  In the logs I see:

{noformat}

fields.description:
On the draft overview page
1. Click "View Changes" for a draft
2. Close resulting lightbox
3. Click "View Changes" for a different draft 
4. Lightbox is displayed showing diff from step 2, then updates with diff from step 3. The delay is quite noticeable - enough to confuse users.

The problem is exacerbated by CONF-16359 - the "no changes" alert is preventing the lightbox content from updating, so the user confusingly sees a lightbox showing (incorrect) changes and an alert saying there are no changes - screenshot attached.
fields.summary: From the draft overview page, the draft diff (view change) lightbox first displays the previously displayed diff and then updates that with the diff the user chose to see. Content should be updated before being displayed to the user.

fields.description:
# Add Page
# Wait for draft to be saved
# Click "view change" link
# Lightbox reports "An unknown error has occurred. Please check your logs" - screenshot attached
(I couldn't see anything related to this in the logs)
fields.summary: Unknown error reported when viewing change for a new page

fields.description:
The problem happens in Confluence 3.0 with (Firefox 3.0) but not with (IE). However, this problem is not reproducible in Confluence 2.10.x with both browsers.

Please see the following screen shots:
* Confluence 3.0.0_01 
** Firefox 3.0 - [screen shot|^3.0.png]
** IE 6 - [screen shot|^IE6.png]
* Confluence 2.10.3 
** Firefox 3.0 - [screen shot|^2.10.3.png]

This seems to be an invalid [CSS overflow|http://www.w3schools.com/Css/pr_pos_overflow.asp] property being set. Please see the [overflow.png|^overflow.png] screen shot. Changing the "overflow :hidden" property to "overflow: visible" [fix the problem|^overflow-visible.png].
fields.summary: Edit Page layout is broken in Firefox browser

fields.description:
When multiple tasklists are added to a page, only the 1st tasklist can have items added to it.  When you attempt to add items to all other lists, the page refreshes and the item is NOT added. 

It appears that all the AJAX functions only work for the 1st tasklist.

This problem only occurs when the space is using Default theme, it works fine when using Left Nav theme.

This problem does NOT occur in FireFox.
fields.summary: Dynamic Tasklist V2 fails in IE7

fields.description:
Currently tables are rendered like this: {code} //Wiki || foo || bar || | 1 | a | | 2 | b| //Rendered HTML (only relevant part)
Foo Bar
1 a
2 b
{code} This is incorrect, because headers are under tag. The correct html renderization would be: {code} //A better HTML renderization for tables - Note thead and (optional) tfoot tags
Foo Bar
1 a
2 b
{code} This will be improve anothers systems - like Google Docs ([importHtml or importXml functions|http://docs.google.com/support/bin/answer.py?answer=75507]) or XPath expressions or JSON/JQuery objects - to interact better with Confluence pages.
fields.summary: Table headers are renderized under tbody tag and causes poor integration with Google Docs, XPath and another systems
